<br>
Sexual assaults over the last 12 months are <h8>`r ifelse(sexassaults_city$inc_prior3yearavgtolast12>=0," up"," down")` `r ifelse(sexassaults_city$inc_prior3yearavgtolast12>=0,sexassaults_city$inc_prior3yearavgtolast12,substring(sexassaults_city$inc_prior3yearavgtolast12,2))`%</h8> compared to the annual average over the last three years, according to San Jose Police Department data through `r format(asofdate, "%B %d")`.

The city averaged <h8>`r round(sexassaults_city$last12mos/52,0)`</h8> sexual assaults a week over the last 12 months. In 2019, that number was <h8>`r round(sexassaults_city$total19/52,0)`</h8> a week.

The San Jose Police Department does not release crime data broken down by more detailed neighborhoods or areas as many other cities do, including San Francisco and Oakland. The city police do post online data about police reports or requests for service, but that data often includes calls or reports that are not equivalent to crimes, among other problems. It is not reliable for showing the level of crime in local neighborhoods.
